meanings.definition: The activity of controlling, and usually limiting, general access to something
meanings.sent1: In the office, the gatekeeping of important documents is crucial to maintain security.
meanings.sent2: The gatekeeping at the event ensured only ticket holders could enter.
meanings.sent3: The gatekeeping of the cookie jar by the mom led to some creative midnight snack missions.
meanings.sent4: Her gatekeeping of emotions was like a fortress, never letting anyone see her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The gatekeeping of the treasure chest by the pirate captain made the crew eager to discover what was inside.

meanings.definition: The act of deciding who is allowed to have access to a particular group or category
meanings.sent1: The gatekeeping of the exclusive club was strict, only allowing members inside.
meanings.sent2: Gatekeeping in the competition determined which teams could advance to the finals.
meanings.sent3: The gatekeeping of the last piece of cake caused a hilarious argument among the siblings.
meanings.sent4: Her gatekeeping of friendship was like a bouncer at a club, only letting in those she trusted.
meanings.sent5: The gatekeeping of secrets in the small town made gossip spread like wildfire.
